thread.title: Headteacher who starred in TV’s Come Dine With Me found dead in church graveyard near his school
thread.title_full: Headteacher who starred in TV’s Come Dine With Me found dead in church graveyard near his school

author: iwarnes3
title: Headteacher who starred in TV’s Come Dine With Me found dead in church graveyard near his school
text:
TV Magazine 'an inspiration to many' Headteacher who starred in TV’s Come Dine With Me found dead in church graveyard near his school 
Pupils at Albert Primary in Penarth, Wales, paid tribute to 51-year-old Huw Jones after he was found dead this morning BY INDRA WARNES Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A HEADTEACHER who was in TV’s Come Dine With Me has been found dead in a church graveyard near his school. 
Huw Jones, 51, was discovered on Wednesday, just weeks after his school, Albert Primary in Penarth, near Cardiff, was rated excellent by Ofsted inspectors. Wales News Service 4 Huw Jones, 51, appeared on a Shrove Tuesday special edition of Channel 4’s Come Dine With Me in 2011 
All children at the 400-pupil school have been offered counselling following the shock death of the much-loved teacher, who was today praised for inspiring students. 
One wrote on Facebook: “Mr Jones was such an exciting new headteacher for everyone at Albert primary… he brought out my inner dramatic side completely and really helped me discover my love for performing at such a young age. Wales News Service Pupils from the 51-year-old’s school paid tributes to their ‘inspiring’ teacher 
“Woke up to the saddest news, rest in peace Huw, you were an inspiration to many xx.” 
Mr Jones appeared on a Shrove Tuesday special edition of Channel 4’s Come Dine With Me in 2011. 
The show, which shows Mr Jones tossing pancakes, has been repeated many times since. 
In 2010 Mr Jones ran the London Marathon to raise awareness and money for a diabetes charity. Wales News Service In 2011 Mr Jones appeared on a Shrove Tuesday special of Come Dine With Me (pictured in the blue shirt) 
One parent paid tribute to the married headteacher, saying: “This is a terrible tragedy. 
“He was such a good sport and even went on Come Dine with Me. 
“He was one of those heads you could easily talk to. 
“Mr Jones has been at this school for about 12 years and is very popular. 
“He has been under a lot of pressure like a lot of heads these days. Wales News Service Just weeks ago Albert Primary had received an excellent rating by Ofsted inspectors related stories WATER IDIOT! Death-wish swimmer spotted taking a dip in huge waves off coast of Devon as Storm Doris approaches the UK for the weekend DEATH IN PARADISE Brit dies while snorkelling Great Barrier Reef weeks after poisonous jellyfish linked to spate of deaths CRASH TRAGEDY Woman pedestrian dies after collision involving bike and car that failed to stop 'SO SMALL BUT LIFE-CHANGING' Little girl, 3, who cut her knee at school nearly DIES after infection damages her heart MISSING BOY BODY FIND Police discover two bodies in River Medway with one belonging to a teen who vanished after night out superstore's superstar Sir Ken Morrison dies aged 85 after turning two market stalls into a £6bn FTSE 100 chain 
“We feel so sorry for his family.” 
Police are now investigating Mr Jones’ death, and a spokeman for South Wales Police confirmed his next of kin have been informed.
